labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is focused on integrating with Obsidian, a popular note-taking and knowledge management application. The core functionality revolves around interacting with notes within an Obsidian vault, enabling the creation, modification, deletion, searching, and organization of note files. The available tools allow for precise manipulation of content within notes, such as inserting content relative to headings or frontmatter, appending content, and listing or searching files. This server enhances productivity by automating and streamlining the management of notes in Obsidian.
labels.reasoning: The primary label **File Management** was chosen because the server's main functionality is centered around managing files (notes) within an Obsidian vault, including operations like reading, writing, searching, and deleting files. The **Memory Management** secondary label is appropriate because the server interacts with a knowledge base (Obsidian vault) and aids in organizing information. The **Daily Productivity** secondary label was selected because the server's tools enhance personal organization and productivity by automating note-taking tasks. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Obsidian Integration Server
server_info_crawled.author: @gregkonush/mcp-obsidian
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable your AI assistants to seamlessly interact with your notes. Read, create, and manipulate files in your Obsidian vault effortlessly, enhancing your productivity and organization.

tools.name: get_active_file
tools.description: Deploy Server Obsidian Integration Server Claim Server @gregkonush/mcp-obsidian Try in Playground get_active_file

tools.name: delete_active_file
tools.description: Deletes the currently active file in Obsidian.

tools.name: insert_active_file
tools.description: Allows you to modify the content relative to a heading, block reference, or frontmatter field in your document.

tools.name: append_active_file
tools.description: Appends content to the end of the currently-open note.

tools.name: insert_file
tools.description: Insert content into an existing note relative to a heading within your note. Allows you to modify the content relative to a heading, block reference, or frontmatter field in your document.

tools.name: search_simple
tools.description: Search for documents matching a specified text query

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@gregkonush/mcp-obsidian/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: obsidianToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: The authentication token for accessing Obsidian.
